com.percussion.webservices.security
Interface IPSSecurityWs

public interface IPSSecurityWs

This interface defines all security related webservices.

Method Summary

Method Detail

login

PSLogin login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
              String user,
              String password,
              String clientId,
              String community,
              String localeCode)
              throws IOException,
                     LoginException,
                     javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     PSInternalRequestCallException
Logon the user for the supplied credentials and the requested community and locale.

Parameters:
request - the servlet request, not null.
response - the servlet response, not null.
user - the name of the user to logon, not null or empty. Case-sensitivity is dependent on the login module implementation, but the Rhythmyx server is not case-sensitive in regards to user names.
password - the users password, not null or empty. Case-sensitivity is dependent on the login module implementation, but generally passwords are case-sensitive.
clientId - the client id, may be null or empty. If a valid client id is provided, it will be used for design object locks instead of the session id. This allows a client to reuse the object locks after a server crash if the same client id is supplied with the re-login.
community - the community name into which to logon the user, defaults to the last logged in community or the first community by name if the user has not logged in before.
localeCode - the locale into which to logon the user, defaults to the last logged in locale or us-en if the user never logged in before.
Returns:
the login information including the session, the roles, communities and locales the user is a member of, never null.
Throws:
IOException
LoginException
javax.servlet.ServletException
PSInternalRequestCallException

logout

void logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
            String session)
Logout the user associated with the supplied session.

Parameters:
request - the servlet request, not null.
session - the session to be invalidated, not null or empty.

refreshSession

void refreshSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    String session)
                    throws LoginException
Refresh the supplied session. If the supplied session is valid, the session timeout will be reset, otherwise an error is returned.

Parameters:
request - the servlet request, not null.
session - a valid session to be refreshed, not null or empty.
Throws:
LoginException - if the supplied session is invalid.

loadCommunities

List<PSCommunity> loadCommunities(String name)
Load all communities for the supplied name.

Parameters:
name - the name of the community to load, may be null or empty in which case all communities will be loaded, wildcards are accepted.
Returns:
all found communities for the supplied name in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, ascending alpha ordered by name.

loadRoles

List<PSRole> loadRoles(String name)
Load all roles for the supplied name.

Parameters:
name - the name or the role to load, may be null or empty, wildcards are accepted.
Returns:
all found roles for the supplied name in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, ascending alpha ordered by name.

filterByRuntimeVisibility

List<IPSGuid> filterByRuntimeVisibility(List<IPSGuid> ids)
Filter the supplied list of guids by the current user's runtime visibility permissions to each.

Parameters:
ids - The list to filter, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
The filtered list, never null, may be empty.

getRequestContext

IPSRequestContext getRequestContext()
Get the request context for the current user thread.

Returns:
The request context, may be null if the request context has not yet been initialized for the current thread. See reconnectSession(PSSecurityToken) for more info.

restoreRequestContext

void restoreRequestContext(IPSRequestContext ctx)
Restore the request context and user session referenced by the supplied request context.

Parameters:
ctx - The request context to restore, may not be null and should have been obtained previously by calling getRequestContext().

login

PSLogin login(String user,
              String password,
              String community,
              String localeCode)
              throws LoginException
Login as the specified user. The request context and session for the current thread will be updated to reflect the specified user. To restore the user context in place prior to calling this method, first call getRequestContext() to get a handle to the current request context, then call this method, and later call restoreRequestContext(IPSRequestContext) with the previously obtained request context.

Parameters:
user - the name of the user to logon, not null or empty. Case-sensitivity is dependent on the login module implementation, but the Rhythmyx server is not case-sensitive in regards to user names.
password - the users password, not null or empty. Case-sensitivity is dependent on the login module implementation, but generally passwords are case-sensitive.
community - the name of the community to log the user into, may be null or empty in which case it defaults to the last logged in community or the first community by name if the user has not logged in before.
localeCode - the locale to set as the user's current locale, may be null or empty in which case it defaults to the last logged in locale or us-en if the user never logged in before.
Returns:
The login information for the specified user, never null.
Throws:
LoginException - If the authentication fails.

getSecurityToken

PSSecurityToken getSecurityToken()
Get the security token that references the user session of the current thread.

Returns:
The token, may be null if a session has not been associated with the current thread.

reconnectSession

boolean reconnectSession(PSSecurityToken token)
Reconnect the user session specified by the supplied security token to the current thread and initialize the request context. Generally used to perform background processing in a new thread on behalf of the current user by calling getSecurityToken(), passing this object to the new thread, and then calling this method in that new thread.

Parameters:
token - The security token, may not be null.
Returns:
true if the specified session was reconnected, false if the specified session is no longer valid.
